body.p:
Richmond Ky
Sept 13th 1865
Gov Bramlet
Dear Sir

We defended Young B Gatliff. The statement of his in his Petition to you for a Pardon -- is are substantialy what was proved in the case. Gatliff shot at Graves a little before Graves fired -- Graves was only slightly wounded in one or two of his fingers -- He we understand does not want Gatliff -- punished butt if here he would sign Gatliffs Petition himself

We think it a clear case for Executive Clemency -- & respectfully but urgently request that young Gatliff be pardoned -- He is a young man of good character -- high spritited & a keene sense of Honor -- He served as a Soldier 3 years in the 7th Ky intft U. S. A.

Truly Yours
J. W. Caperton
C. F. Burnam
